channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15424] Add bulk load hfile-refs for replication in ZK after the event is appended in the WAL
item.description: Currenlty hfile-refs znode used for tracking the bulk loaded data replication is added first and then the bulk load event in appended in the WAL. So this may lead to a issue where the znode is added in ZK but append to WAL is failed(due to some probelm in DN), so this znode will be left in ZK as it is and will not allow hfile to get deleted from archive directory.
item.summary: Add bulk load hfile-refs for replication in ZK after the event is appended in the WAL

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: To fix this I am planning to move the logic of adding hfile-refs znode in ZK in post-append task of WAL append for bulk load event.
So when WAL write fails, what u will do?

When wal write fails (then any way we will not be able replicate the hfile) we will not be adding the hfile-refs node in zk.

But there is another existing issue when the hfile is successfully loaded but writing to wal is failed so in this case source cluster will have the data but peer will not have. IMO we can discuss this in a separate jira.

-1 overall

One Q
When the bulk load added WAL entry and while adding the HFile ref into zk, that op failed. What do we do then?

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-1.3-IT #593 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3-IT/593/)
HBASE-15424 Add bulk load hfile-refs for replication in ZK after the (ashishsinghi: rev bcbef7b401e211ad7cfcdcd176abafe7f30dbbe8)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/wal/DisabledWALProvider.java

The bulk load data gets replicated to peer cluster based on the wal entries. The hfle-refs in ZK is mainly to avoid the hfile from getting cleaned up by the hfile cleaner from the archive directory.
